result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra J Stukel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To be determined.
AMENDED 07-06-2016:  Restitution is set at zero ($0).

Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.
AMENDED 07-06-2016:  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cassandra J Stukel in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    

No restitution is being requested.
Therefore, Court sets Restitution @ $0.00.
Any bail monies being held are to be applied to Costs/Fines/Surcharges and any balance to be refunded to the posting party.
Amended JOC to be prepared.
Restitution hearing on July 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Treatment letter filed by Attorney Rosario.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Cassandra J Stukel in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moved to strike penalty enhancer with a plea to the charge. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to the charge with the penalty enhancer stricken. Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant. 
Court strikes penalty enhancer (repeater allegation) and found defendant guilty of the charge.
  
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

225 DAYS JAIL (STRAIGHT TIME)  

TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

RESTITUTION:  HELD OPEN; to be determined - restitution hearing scheduled.

COURT COSTS:  $253.00 (includes $10.00 DRGOD assessment), to be paid as a condition of probation;

DNA SURCHARGE:  Waived, already provided.  Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation.

**30 days jail with huber, as a condition of probation; release for treatment, counseling, treatment, STAYED, to be used at agent's discretion. 

  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
